    • Constructor Detail

      • Handler

        public Handler(org.json.JSONObject obj,
               Notifier notifier,
               int id,
               boolean raw)
        Constructor, if incoming message was parsed successfully to JSON by Notifier.
        Parameters:
        obj - The JSONObject that represents the message to be parsed.
        notifier - The Notifier that spawned this Handler. Needed for back-communication.
        id - The ID of the message this Handler parses. Used for identification.
        raw - A boolean value to force RAW-mode even if a JSONObject was passed. This will supress any answers sent to telegram, assuming that this was a console message.

      • Handler

        public Handler(org.json.JSONObject obj,
               Notifier notifier,
               int id)
        Constructor, if incoming message was parsed successfully to JSON by Notifier.
        Parameters:
        obj - The JSONObject that represents the message to be parsed.
        notifier - The Notifier that spawned this Handler. Needed for back-communication.
        id - The ID of the message this Handler parses. Used for identification.

      • Handler

        public Handler(java.lang.String message,
               Notifier notifier,
               int id)
        Constructor, if incoming message couldn't be parsed to JSON by Notifier. This happens, when the incoming messageString is not in JSON, but in RAW format. A flag is set internally that the Message handled by this Handler was in RAW format.
        Parameters:
        message - The messageString to be parsed by this Handler.
        notifier - The Notifier that spawned this Handler. Needed for back-comminication.
        id - The ID of the message this Handler parses. Used for identification.

    • Method Detail

      • parseMessageJSON

        private boolean parseMessageJSON(org.json.JSONObject obj)
        This method is used for parsing incoming messages, when they are provided as JSONObject. In those cases, incoming messageStrings have successfully been tested as JSON Strings and parsed by the Notifier.
        Parameters:
        obj - The JSONObject provided that represents the message this Handler should handle.
        Returns:
        True when parsing succeeded, false when not.

      • parseMessageRAW

        private boolean parseMessageRAW(java.lang.String messageString)
        This method is used for parsing incoming messageStrings, which are RAW messages (e.g. from a plain console for debugging purposes instead of telegram cli). These messages are not formatted as JSON, only their message content is provided. This method checks if the incoming messageString really is a RAW message, and then passes it to parseMessageRAWFinal(java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        messageString - The messageString to parse.
        Returns:
        True when parsing succeeded, false when not.
        See Also:
        parseMessageRAWFinal(String)

      • parseMessageRAWFinal

        private boolean parseMessageRAWFinal(java.lang.String messageString)
        This method is just used internally, only after an incoming messageString has been checked for truly being a RAW messageString. It shouldn't be used from any other place than parseMessageRAW(String).
        Parameters:
        messageString - The messageString to be parsed.
        Returns:
        True if parsing succeeded, false when not.
        See Also:
        parseMessageRAW(String)

      • detectAccount

        private void detectAccount()
        Used internally for the procedure to load the sender's account by his ID. It is saved internally and used by other methods.

      • dealAccountOnline

        private void dealAccountOnline()
        Used internally for the procedure of a) sending the User a welcome message if he was offline before, and b) to set an offline timer to the sender's account to set him offline again after a given time. Uses the account loaded by detectAccount(), that was saved internally.

      • handleMessage

        private void handleMessage(java.lang.String[] message)
        The actual procedure to handle the message. It checks the message's contents for known commands, and passes the message to the procedures to handle the specific context. Further syntax planned.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be handled.
